definitions: the middle class, typically with reference to its perceived materialistic values or conventional attitudes

examples.text: the rise of the bourgeoisie at the end of the eighteenth century
the landed gentry were replaced by a local bourgeoisie

definitions: (in Marxist contexts) the capitalist class who own most of society's wealth and means of production

examples.text: the conflict of interest between the bourgeoisie and the proletariat

shortDefinitions: (in Marxist contexts) capitalist class who own most of society's wealth and means of production
